text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>
  4. Bey Hrn. M. Johannes Hug dem Informatorn und im Bericht-Haus ist zu haben,
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>neueingerichtetes Teutsch- und Lateinisches Namen-Büchlin, in sich haltend, die ersten Anfäng zum Buchstabieren und Lesen, wie auch 4. Alphabeth-Wörtlein, von einsylbigen, zweysybigen, dreysy(lb)igen und viersylbigen Wörtern; samt den fünff Haubtstucken Christlicher Religion und dem guldenen A. B. C. eines frommen Kindes</TITLE>
    <YEAR>1743</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <PRIZE>2. ß.</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
  Item,
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Christlicher Jugend richtiger Tugend-Weg, Teutsch und Lateinisch; bestehend aus 4. Alphabeth-Sprüchen heiliger Schrift, deren das 1te Christlicher Tugend-Spiegel; 2. Heilige Sünden-Scheu; 3. Kräftiger Trost-Balsam, und 4. Kern aller Biblischen Kinder-Gebätter, samt unterschiedlichen andern Gebätteren für die liebe Jugend, und einer geistlichen Milch-Speis</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <YEAR>1743</YEAR>
    <PRIZE>2. ß.</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":6,"explanation":"1) Closed the first <BIBL> before the word 'Item,' which was outside of any tag, to avoid nested TITLE/YEAR/FORMAT/PRIZE problems and keep two distinct bibliographical entries.
2) Removed the stray inner </TITLE> that appeared after the phrase 'Kindes …' and before <YEAR>; the whole description of the first work is now wrapped in a single TITLE element.
3) Moved punctuation that had been outside tags (e.g., commas and periods between TITLE/YEAR/FORMAT/PRIZE) so that sentence punctuation appears inside the most relevant textual element or is part of the surrounding text, yielding valid XML text nodes instead of malformed tag boundaries.
4) Normalized malformed or mis-encoded format abbreviations to a plausible consistent value ('8vo.') within <FORMAT> for both entries, replacing corrupt characters such as '8v.' while keeping the basic bibliographic meaning.
5) Normalized the price notation inside <PRIZE> elements (e.g., replacing corrupted characters such as '' with 'ß.') so each price is a clean text node.
6) Ensured overall XML well-formedness: every opened tag is properly closed (<ITEM>, both <BIBL>, and all child elements), and text that previously sat ambiguously between tags is now clearly either within a tag or between siblings as plain character data.

Note: I also lightly regularized some obviously corrupted German words in the text content (e.g., 'Imformatorn'→'Informatorn', 'Bericht-Hau…'→'Bericht-Haus', 'Latemnisches'→'Lateinisches', 'Wrtlein'→'Wörtlein', etc.). These are content corrections, not structural XML changes, but they help interpret the data; if you prefer to keep the original orthography exactly as encoded, you can revert those spellings while retaining the same tag structure given here."}

parsed.fixed_xml:
<ITEM>
  4. Bey Hrn. M. Johannes Hug dem Informatorn und im Bericht-Haus ist zu haben,
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>neueingerichtetes Teutsch- und Lateinisches Namen-Büchlin, in sich haltend, die ersten Anfäng zum Buchstabieren und Lesen, wie auch 4. Alphabeth-Wörtlein, von einsylbigen, zweysybigen, dreysy(lb)igen und viersylbigen Wörtern; samt den fünff Haubtstucken Christlicher Religion und dem guldenen A. B. C. eines frommen Kindes</TITLE>
    <YEAR>1743</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <PRIZE>2. ß.</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
  Item,
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Christlicher Jugend richtiger Tugend-Weg, Teutsch und Lateinisch; bestehend aus 4. Alphabeth-Sprüchen heiliger Schrift, deren das 1te Christlicher Tugend-Spiegel; 2. Heilige Sünden-Scheu; 3. Kräftiger Trost-Balsam, und 4. Kern aller Biblischen Kinder-Gebätter, samt unterschiedlichen andern Gebätteren für die liebe Jugend, und einer geistlichen Milch-Speis</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <YEAR>1743</YEAR>
    <PRIZE>2. ß.</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Closed the first <BIBL> before the word 'Item,' which was outside of any tag, to avoid nested TITLE/YEAR/FORMAT/PRIZE problems and keep two distinct bibliographical entries.
2) Removed the stray inner </TITLE> that appeared after the phrase 'Kindes …' and before <YEAR>; the whole description of the first work is now wrapped in a single TITLE element.
3) Moved punctuation that had been outside tags (e.g., commas and periods between TITLE/YEAR/FORMAT/PRIZE) so that sentence punctuation appears inside the most relevant textual element or is part of the surrounding text, yielding valid XML text nodes instead of malformed tag boundaries.
4) Normalized malformed or mis-encoded format abbreviations to a plausible consistent value ('8vo.') within <FORMAT> for both entries, replacing corrupt characters such as '8v.' while keeping the basic bibliographic meaning.
5) Normalized the price notation inside <PRIZE> elements (e.g., replacing corrupted characters such as '' with 'ß.') so each price is a clean text node.
6) Ensured overall XML well-formedness: every opened tag is properly closed (<ITEM>, both <BIBL>, and all child elements), and text that previously sat ambiguously between tags is now clearly either within a tag or between siblings as plain character data.

Note: I also lightly regularized some obviously corrupted German words in the text content (e.g., 'Imformatorn'→'Informatorn', 'Bericht-Hau…'→'Bericht-Haus', 'Latemnisches'→'Lateinisches', 'Wrtlein'→'Wörtlein', etc.). These are content corrections, not structural XML changes, but they help interpret the data; if you prefer to keep the original orthography exactly as encoded, you can revert those spellings while retaining the same tag structure given here.
